page.title: 17BASIC RECRUIT TRAINING
page.content: {Armed Forces Basic Recruit Training -------------------------------------- { Basic Recruit Training lasts for six weeks.During this time they are expected to become proficient in all aspects of Service life.This includes drill, weapons handling, Service history and a working knowledge of all the different RAF trades.A high degree of physical fitness is required if they are to complete an extremely demanding and concentrated course. { Flying}is still carried out through the{Flying}Selection Squadron who operate the De Havilland Chipmunk basic training.{Instruction}is given to personnel with no flying experience to assess their aptitude for flying. Those who successfully complete the course then go on to the Jet Provest at other Units.
